Package ParticleEngine

Class ParticleEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • ParticleEngine.ParticleEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ParticleRunner
    public class ParticleEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements ParticleRunner
    The ParticleEngine class wraps together ParticleDrawable, Particle, and applies many properties.
    See Also:
    Properties are defined in both specific numbers, and enums, ParticleBehavior, ParticleInteraction, All properties of a ParticleEngine can be set using a JSON file, setup(JSONObject, ParticleDrawable)

      • setup

        public final void setup​(ParticleBehavior[] behaviors,
                        ParticleInteraction[] interactions,
                        GenerationType generationType,
                        int count,
                        ParticleDrawable drawer)
        Setup the properties of the engine
        Parameters:
        behaviors - A list of behaviors the particles will follow
        interactions - A list of interaction types
        generationType - How the particles will be generated
        count - The number of particles
        drawer - A ParticleDrawable object to determine how to draw the particles
        See Also:
        ParticleDrawable, ParticleInteraction, ParticleBehavior, GenerationType

      • setup

        public final void setup​(processing.data.JSONObject params,
                        ParticleDrawable dr)
                 throws InvalidJSONException
        Load the properties of the engine through a JSON file. Format: { "setup":{ "behaviors":[behaviorA, behaviorB], "interactions":[interactionA,interactionB], "gentype":gentype, "number":how many particles, } "args":{ //(all args are optional) "bounds":[w,h], "initial":InitialBehavior, "initialArg":InitialBehaviorArg, "origin":[x,y], "IV":[x,y], //Initial Velocity "speed":speedFactor, "RND":random noise differential, "NMF":noise map factor, "maxlife":max life of particles, "APF":amount per frame } } All of the "args" match mutator methods of this class. Each has its own documentation.
        Parameters:
        params - Some json file you have loaded that is formatted correctly
        dr - a Particle drawer
        Throws:
        InvalidJSONException
        See Also:
        setup(ParticleBehavior[], ParticleInteraction[], GenerationType, int, ParticleDrawable), ParticleDrawable, ParticleEngine, InvalidJSONException

      • setBounds

        public final void setBounds​(int width,
                            int height)
        Set the bounds of the system. When using ParticleInteraction#Particle_Window_Collision this limits where they can go Otherwise, they will be able to leave these bounds
        Parameters:
        width - width of container
        height - height of container

        public final void setInitialBehavior​(InitialBehavior initialBehavior)
        Setup how particles will behave when spawned More information can be specified in ParticleEngine#setInitialBehaviorArg(float)
        Parameters:
        initialBehavior - InitialBehavior enum
        See Also:
        InitialBehavior, setInitialBehaviorArg(float)

      • setInitialVelocity

        public final void setInitialVelocity​(int x,
                                     int y)
        Determine the specified initial velocity of particles (Not normalized) This will have no affect unless you are using Exact_IV or Randomly_Varying_IV InitialBehaviors
        Parameters:
        x - velocity x
        y - velocity y
        See Also:
        InitialBehavior, setInitialBehavior(InitialBehavior)

        Set the mass for particles
        Parameters:
        particlemass - new mass

      • setSpeedFactor

        public final void setSpeedFactor​(float f)
        Slow down or speed up particles. Ex: 0 = stopped Ex: 1 = normal Ex: .5 = 50% speed
        Parameters:
        f - value

      • setDrawer

        public final void setDrawer​(ParticleDrawable drawer)
        Set the particle drawer of an engine (or change it if it already exists)
        Parameters:
        drawer - new drawer
        See Also:
        ParticleDrawable

      • setRandomNoiseDifferencial

        public final void setRandomNoiseDifferencial​(float f)
        Set the amount of difference between particles following noise patterns. Should be between 5 and 20 in most cases
        Parameters:
        f - value

      • setNoiseMapFactor

        public final void setNoiseMapFactor​(float noiseMapFactor)
        Determines the size to which the noise values are mapped
        Parameters:
        noiseMapFactor - factor

      • addCustomBehavior

        public final void addCustomBehavior​(CustomParticleBehavior n)

      • setParticleMaxLife

        public void setParticleMaxLife​(int particleMaxLife)
        Set the maximum number of frames for which a particle lives
        Parameters:
        particleMaxLife - life in frames (Use 0 to signify that particles should live forever)

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • reActivate

        public final void reActivate()
        Clear existing particles and start the engine again

      • update

        public final void update()
        The Update method must always be ran in your draw method. This is where particles are updated, and drawn to the screen

      • isActivated

        public final boolean isActivated()
        Accessor method for the engine's state
        Returns:
        if engine is active
        See Also:
        activate(), deActivate()

      • createBatch

        public final void createBatch​(int amt)
        This is used to create a batch of size amt of particles. Only with GenerationType#OnEvent
        Parameters:
        amt - number of particles
        See Also:
        GenerationType

      • produceLightCache

        public final processing.core.PVector[][] produceLightCache​(int frames,
                                                           boolean verbose)
        Used internally. (EXPENSIVE): depending on the number of frames and particles, this could cause you to run out of memory Used to generate the data used in a LightCache
        Parameters:
        frames - number of frames to generate
        Returns:
        cache data
        See Also:
        LightCache

      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty()
        Determine if the engine has no particles
        Returns:
        if the number of particles is equal to zero

        Specified by:
